means: 财产，所有权，占有物，所有物

sentence.Network_en: How had this com-promising picture come into the possession of the press?
sentence.Network_cn: 这张令人难堪的照片是怎么落到媒体手中的？

sentence.Network_en: Possession of cannabis will no longer be an arrestable offence.
sentence.Network_cn: 持有大麻将不再会被拘捕。

sentence.Network_en: He described the picture as his most cherished possession.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说那幅画是他最珍爱的财产。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin possessio(n-), from the verb possidere (see possess)

entry.def: If you are in possession of something, you have it, because you have obtained it or because it belongs to you.

example.ex: Those documents are now in the possession of the Guardian...
example.tran: 那些文件目前在《卫报》手里。

example.ex: We should go up and take possession of the land...
example.tran: 我们应该北上占领那片土地。

entry.def: Your possessions are the things that you own or have with you at a particular time.

example.ex: People had lost their homes and all their possessions...
example.tran: 人们失去了自己的家园和所有的财物。

example.ex: She had tidied away her possessions.

entry.def: A country's possessions are countries or territories that it controls.

example.ex: All of them were French possessions at one time or another.
example.tran: 它们都曾是法国的领地。

entry.def: Possession by an evil spirit is the situation when a person's mind and body is controlled by an evil spirit.

example.ex: They were convinced the girls' behaviour was due to possession by the devil.
example.tran: 他们相信了这些女孩之所以有如此举动是因为鬼魂附体。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of having and controlling property
3. being controlled by passion or the supernatural
4. a mania restricted to one thing or idea
5. a territory that is controllled by a ruling state
6. the trait of resolutely controlling your own behavior
7. (sport) the act of controlling the ball (or puck);

sentences.sentence: "they took possession of the ball on their own goal line"

auth_sentence.content: The club's possession numbers tell a similar story.

auth_sentence.content: Liverpool were controlled in possession and attacked with pace.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"某种物,用品;人等"; 2. 表名词,"动作或状态等"

stems_affixes.word_buile: accord和谐+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.手风琴
carr=carn肉+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.腐肉
champ+ion人→n.冠军,拥护者,战士
cush垫+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.垫子,软垫
manse住宅+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.大厦,大楼;宅第
product产品+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.生产,产品,作品
scorp原意为一种鱼,后指蝎子+ion某种物,用品;人等→n.蝎子
dismiss解散;开除+ion动作或状态等→n.免职,解雇,不予考虑

stems_affixes.value_cn: 允许进入,承认某事之陈述,供认
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad+miss送+ion动作或状态等→送来→许可进入
concise简明的+ion动作或状态等→n.简明,简洁
console安慰+at+ion动作或状态等→n.安慰,慰藉
contradict反驳,矛盾+ion动作或状态等→n.反驳,矛盾
create创造+ion动作或状态等→n.创造,创作物
dilapidate倒塌+ion动作或状态等→n.破旧,荒废

stems_affixes.value_cn: 辨别,区别,识别力,辨别力,歧视
stems_affixes.word_buile: discriminate歧视+ion动作或状态等→n.辨别,区别,识别力,辨别力,歧视
discuss讨论+ion动作或状态等→n.讨论,谈论;论述
edit编辑+ion状态→在以前的基础编辑后→版本,版
expanse膨胀扩张+ion动作或状态等→n.扩张,膨胀;张开,伸展
frict摩擦+ion动作或状态等→n.摩擦,摩擦力
lucubrate用功,深入研究+ion动作或状态等→n.刻苦研究

stems_affixes.value_cn: 航海,航空,导航,领航,航行
stems_affixes.word_buile: navigate航行,航海,导航+ion动作或状态等→n.航海,航空,导航,领航,航行
obligate有责任的+ion动作或状态等→n.义务,责任
obsess迷住,使困扰+ion动作或状态等→n.迷住,困扰
pollute弄脏,污染+ion动作或状态等→污染,玷污

stems_affixes.value_cn: 持有,拥有;所有权;所有物;[
stems_affixes.word_buile: possess占有,拥有+ion动作或状态等→n.持有,拥有;所有权;所有物;[n.]财产,财富
receipt收据,收到+ion动作或状态等→n.接待,招待会,接收
situate使处于+ion动作或状态等→n.情形,境遇

Sentence.sentence: In a recent essay in the New York Review of Books, Robert Darn ton, the head of Harvard University's library, argued that because such books are a common resource – the possession of us all – only public, not-for-profit bodies should be given the power to control them.

means.word_mean: 占有, 持有, 拥有

sentences.en: The Egyptians strove with the Romans for the possession of the Nile Valley.
sentences.cn: 埃及人为占有尼罗河谷而与罗马人斗争。

means.word_mean: 个人财产, 私人财物

sentences.en: She forsook her worldly possessions to devote herself to the church.
sentences.cn: 她抛弃世上的财物而献身教会。

means.word_mean: 领地, 属地, 殖民地

sentences.en: India was Britain's former overseas possession.
sentences.cn: 印度是英国过去的海外领地。

jushi.english: Peter's possessions roused his brother's jealousy.
jushi.chinese: 彼得的财产引起了他弟弟的妒忌。

jushi.english: When her father died, she came into possession of a large fortune.
jushi.chinese: 她的父亲死后,她继承了一大笔财产。

jushi.english: While our team is in possession the other team can't score.
jushi.chinese: 我们队控制球时,对方就无法得分。
